intro: Rollinia dolichopetala, commonly known as the long-petioled rollinia, is a tropical plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Myristicaceae and is characterized by its large, palmate leaves that can reach up to 30 cm in diameter. The plant produces yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in panicles, followed by edible fruits that are spherical and have a sweet, aromatic flavor. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of tropical rainforests.
